doc.field: Series IV: The American Socialist Party
Subseries IV:I: The Socialist Party and the United Auto Workers, 1937-1941
Series IV: The American Socialist Party
Subseries IV:I: The Socialist Party and the United Auto Workers, 1937-1941
Daniel Bell Research Files on U.S. Communism, Socialism, and the Labor Movement
Daniel Bell Research Files on U.S. Communism, Socialism, and the Labor Movement

Socialist Party and the United Automobile Workers Union. Contents: Letters and memos on S.P. activities and policies in auto; Gerry Allard, editor of The Socialist Call, correspondence on the situation in auto, 1937 1938; Roy Burt, Executive Secretary, correspondence on auto, 1937 1939; Norman Thomas, correspondence on auto, 1938 1939; Socialist Auto League Reports, 1938 1939; Contents: Socialist Auto League Bulletins, 1938; Minutes of the National Steering Committee, Socialist Auto League, 1938; Reports of the National Action Committee, Socialist Auto League, 1938; Policy statements, reports, pamphlets and miscellaneous bulletins concerning the auto situation, 1937 1941; Report issued by Homer Martin concerning a Communist Party meeting with auto leaders.

Socialist Party and the United Automobile Workers Union.
